arm_group.description: 2 sprays per nostril 3 times a day for a period of two months
2 sprays per nostril 3 times a day for a period of two months

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate whether treatment with a nasal spray based on
      resveratrol has some benefit in patients with seasonal allergic rhinitis, mild, moderate, or
      severe.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Beneficial Effects of a Nasal Spray of Resveratrol in Children With Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis

detailed_description.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate whether treatment with a nasal spray based on
      resveratrol has some benefit in patients with seasonal allergic rhinitis, mild, moderate, or
      severe. The primary objective is to assess whether the treatment with nasal spray based
      resveratrol is able to improve the allergic rhinitis symptoms  during the two months of
      treatment. The secondary aim is to evaluate if the resveratrol nasal spray is able to reduce
      respiratory infections and wheezing episodes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Children of both sexes, ranging in age from 4 to 17 years

          -  History of seasonal allergic rhinitis, mild, moderate or severe, defined according to
             the ARIA guidelines in 2010, documented by recurrent episodes in the previous year
             and confirmed by a positive skin test results

          -  Written informed consent from at least one parent or a legal representative

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Lack of informed consent in writing by at least one parent or a legal representative

          -  Concomitant disorders, such as infection of the upper (sinusitis, etc..) or lower
             respiratory tract, nasal surgery in the last year, abnormalities of the respiratory
             tract, immune diseases

          -  Use of antihistamines, nasal or systemic corticosteroids, leukotriene modifiers,
             cromolyn sodium, in the last six weeks

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Beneficial Effects of a Nasal Spray of Resveratrol in Children With Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis

primary_outcome.description: Nasal symptoms (itching, sneezing, rhinorrhea, and obstruction) will be scored by a four-point scale (0=no symptom; 1=mild; 2= moderate; 3= severe) and record by parents on a daily diary card.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The cough presence and severity will be assessed during the day and the night by four-point scale and recorded by parents on a daily diary card.
Wheezing will be assessed using the same four-point scale and record by parents on a daily diary card.
The albuterol use on demand will be record by parents on a daily diary card.
The days with fever will be record by parents on a daily diary card.
School absences will be record by a diary card.
Evaluation of Cetirizine syrup on-demand use will be record by parents on a diary card
Emergency room visits for respiratory problems will be record by parents on a diary card.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
